ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with early-onset ataxia, hypotonia, dystonia, and oculomotor abnormalities (strabismus). Age of onset (6 years) fits the typical presentation.
Similar to reference cases 1 and 2, presents with ataxia and oculomotor dysfunction (strabismus). Hypotonia and dystonia can be associated features.
Another form of ataxia with oculomotor apraxia that can present with similar features including ataxia, hypotonia, and eye movement abnormalities.
Similar to reference case 3, presents with dystonia, ataxia, and hypotonia. The patient's phenotype shows overlap with this condition.
Can present in childhood with ataxia, hypotonia, and oculomotor abnormalities. Dystonia can be an associated feature.
Mitochondrial disorder that can present with ataxia, hypotonia, dystonia, and eye movement abnormalities in early childhood.
